title: About
text: This website is powered by Quarto, a powerful and flexible content management system that allows for easy creation, management, and publishing of content. With its user-friendly interface and built-in SEO tools, Quarto enables users to effectively and efficiently showcase their products, services, or ideas online.

title: Userguide
text: To learn more about how to use this website and what does it do, please read the information below.

title: Userguide
text:
Demo on this site

Single File
 To predict the classification of a single image, select the “Single File” section. First, click the “Choose File” button and select an image from your computer. Once the image is uploaded, the prediction will be displayed automatically below the image. You will see both the image you uploaded and the prediction result.


Multiple Files
 To predict the classification of multiple images, select the “Multiple Files” section. First, click the “Choose File” button and select an image from your computer. Once the image is uploaded, the prediction will be displayed automatically below the image. You will see both the image you uploaded and the prediction result.  Please note that the output for multiple images may appear below the footer of the website. To view your result, please scroll down. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and are actively working to identify the cause of the issue and implement a solution.

title: Userguide
text:
Demo on Hugging Face
 The following is a description of a program available on Hugging Face. The left box displays the input, while the right box shows the output, which is a classification of land vehicles into seven categories: Big Truck, Bus, Van, Motorcycle, Military Vehicle, Pickup Truck, and Car. The output also includes the probability of each classification. You can find a link to the project on the site here.

title: Land Vehicle Classification
text:
This project utilizes the fastai library and deep learning techniques to train a model for identifying vehicles.
The trained model is hosted on Huggingface, and a JavaScript API has been implemented to allow for user input and classification via the website.
The goal of this project is to provide a reliable and accurate method for classifying land vehicles, with potential applications in fields such as autonomous driving and traffic management.
